frameDefinitions: A Speaker conveys a Message to an Experiencer in order to reassure them about a Situation; Medium and the Means of the communication also may be expressed.
A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
This frame contains words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body.
An Agent or Cause makes a Patient sharper or duller.
A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
frameExamples: We <t>reassured</t> him that his decision was sound.
Mo <t>dodged</t>  the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
John is in the basement <t>sharpening</t> his axe.
Ambrose Powell <t>forded</t> over on one horse, and we drove the others after him.
Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
listRoleDefinitions: The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to reassure another person.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> receives reassurance from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is a proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Speaker</fen> wants the <fen>Experiencer</fen> to believe in order to feel reassured.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is the problem plaguing the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, about which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  reassures them.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the reassurance takes place.
The <fen>Dodger</fen> acts to avoid an oncoming <fen>Bad_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Bad_entity</fen> is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the dodging occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the dodging occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> uses some part of his/her body to perform the action. <fen>Agent</fen> occurs as the External Argument.
With some verbs in this frame, the <fen>Body_part</fen> involved in the action is specified by the meaning of the verb and cannot be expressed separately.  For example,
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the body movement occurs.
The location within which the movement of a <fen>Body_part</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become more or less sharp.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is sharpened.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of sharpness.  Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> sharpens <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> sharpens the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> reassured her that she was his favorite ice-skating star.
He tried to reassure <fex>his potential customers</fex> that his company not only offered the best service, but also the most competitive prices.
How do you reassure them <fex>that you really like them</fex>?
The policeman reassured him <fex>about the safety of the neighborhood</fex>.
<fex>Mo</fex> dodged the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mo dodged <fex> the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust</fex>.
<fex>The boy</fex> swung his legs.
Pat yawned (*his mouth).
There was singing for joy in the streets, and <fex>everywhere</fex> people lifting their arms into the air.
<fex>The smith</fex> sharpened many knives in the days before the war.
Several cuts into the log had dulled <fex>the blade</fex>.
<fex>The relentless impacts against the wood</fex> gradually blunted the edge of this axe.
<fex>We</fex> drive down dusty roads, forded through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.
We forded <fex>from the island</fex> to the mainland.
We decided to cut <fex>through the forest</fex>.
I'll cut across the Sahara desert <fex>up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.
We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then cut <fex>west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of  the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.
The Federal Army of the Potomac forded the river <fex>in August 1862</fex>.
The common brook is best forded <fex>south of the hut</fex>.
<fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Alliance for a Better Zambia
